name: 101 Adventure Jam
description:
Historical Fiction based on the Manhatten Project. 

The Idea was that you have VR Glasses that can see into the past. You get to watch Oppenheimer get the history changing orange! Except, where is the orange? It should be on the little wooden table to the left.

Because you are not really in the past, just viewing it, you can't really interact with anything. If you stare at an object, you can fuse with it, triggering an action. It might get someone's attention, or nudge a small object.

Oppenheimer will slowly make his way to the wooden table. The game ends when he reaches it. If the orange is on the table, you win; else you lose.

Play Online in Chrome: http://static.codeorshutup.com/adventureJam/public/index.html

VR Cardboard: Use the online version. When the game loads, tap the Cardboard icon in the lower right of the screen.

Desktop: Click and drag to pan around. Point the circle at an object and wait for the fusing animation to finish. 

Known Bugs:

  • You can not fuse/long look though the transparent NPCs.
  • Lots of visual and other issues.

Source: https://github.com/ripter/adventureJam/releases/tag/1.0.0

To run from source, clone the repro and run `make run`

or without make: `npm install && npm start`
